diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with acute abdominal pain, low-grade fever, nausea, vomiting, and inability to tolerate oral intake after several weeks of low-grade abdominal discomfort. The imaging findings indicated mild dilation of the distal colon and multiple air-fluid levels, which were concerning for postoperative ileus. The clinical presentation and imaging findings, along with the recent history of surgery, supported the diagnosis of perforated diverticulitis.
